03
Matt Hall

I'm a computer scientist and artist with a background in web development.

I'm currently a student at the Ohio State University completing my undergraduate degree in Computer Science with a focus on graphics and art. Some stuff about ACCAD and the work I do there. Stuff about 3D graphics and art. Part about Photography. Offscreen, I climb, bike and run.

I'm always open for commissions and collaborations. Drop me a line:

Resume
02
Matt Hall

Education

The Ohio State University - BS, Computer Science

Centerville City Schools - Engineering Block Program

Professional Experience

P.C. Krause & Associates - Research Intern, Contractor - Wright-Patterson AFB, RQQI

  • Validated three-phase Delta and Wye AC motors to increase system integrity on a Simulink model of a hybriddrone system. Designed and ran experiments to gather data and calculate constants for System Identification.

Air Force Research Lab - Research Intern, Wright Scholars - Wright-Patterson AFB

  • Researched fuel-cooled avionics systems and developed MATLAB software to validate thermal controls models.Measured and controled analog and digital signals with dSPACE data acquisition hardware for an experimentalwater-based fuel thermal management system (FTMS).
  • Constructed a fault detection and mitigation algorithm in Simulink software, applied through dSPACE hardware,that allowed for automated isolation of fluid flow and pressure faults.

Relevant Experiences

Networked Augmented Reality Prototype - August 2019 to present

Worked with a team of faculty and graduate students to develop a multiplayer Augmented Reality (AR)experience in Unity3D and Vuforia to run on mobile phones in a room-scale interactive environment.

HackOHI/O Handwritten Equation Editor App - October 2018

Developed a mobile app (React Native, iOS) allowing students to hand write solutions to online math home-work instead of typing in the equation editor. Built over 36 hours during HackOHI/O, Ohio State's premier hackathon.

Warehouse Automation Research Platform - December 2018 to April 2019

Lead electronics and software designer for the development of a prototype omnidirectional robot chassismodeled after NASAs Lunar Electric Rover for warehouse inventory transport solutions. Utilized on-campusmachining resources and industry standard parts to develop chassis concept. Implemented simultaneousacceleration and velocity control of multiple stepper motors and servos on an Arduino platform.
